column4: KompoZer is NOT a KDE app - the naming has nothing to do with KDE
yes im aware, and if u read that far back i corrected myself ;)
heh, just got that far in the awaylog :S
lol u got ur own repo ;p
yeah, it's a new Launchpad feature being tested
launchpad is the bug-filing system for ubuntu right?
among other things, yes.
what is it your hosting on your repo, whats it for?
It's the Nvu replacement, packaged for edgy and feisty until we can get it in backports.
but what does that have to do with launchpad?
it's a place to host the package
what for?
It makes things more sane when you have the stable and development version on the same machine, for instance.
what goes in this boot partition? grub? how does your bios know to use that partition?
the grub config files, yes, and grub-install goes on the MBR with a pointer to it for the bios
i see...so the MBR is sorta like its own little partition on the first sector of the disk?
yeah, it's the first 512 bytes iirc
alright, makes a little more sense to me now, so grub overwrites that space with a pointer to the /boot partition
yup

but lets say in a dual-boot environment with windows, that point would still go to the /boot partition but inside that partition would be the config files that would let u then boot from another partition to windows for example?
Yeah - !dualboot has more info on that.  Windows would just be another entry like anything else, plus the chainloader +1 option
